body_html: @hholst80 The CPU gives you an exception independent of what you're using (True or False). This is to avoid crashing. NaN would be reasonable, but the real fix would be to get an actual exception to bubble back up to the CPU from the GPU.
body_text: @hholst80 The CPU gives you an exception independent of what you're using (True or False).  This is to avoid crashing.  NaN would be reasonable, but the real fix would be to get an actual exception to bubble back up to the CPU from the GPU.
body: @hholst80 The CPU gives you an exception independent of what you're using (True or False).  This is to avoid crashing.  NaN would be reasonable, but the real fix would be to get an actual exception to bubble back up to the CPU from the GPU.
